1.name: Barbe-bleue
1.description: A young woman becomes the eighth wife of the wealthy Bluebeard, whose first seven wives have died under mysterious circumstances.

2.name: L'homme à la tête en caoutchouc
2.description: A chemist carries out a bizarre experiment with his own head.

3.name: The Big Swallow
3.description: A man, objecting to being filmed, comes closer and closer to the camera lens until his mouth is all we see. Then he opens wide and swallows camera and cinematographer. He steps back, chews, and grins.

4.name: Histoire d'un crime
4.description: A burglar is arrested for a murder. He is condemned to death. Before his execution the murderer dreams of his past, of how he was a bank clerk, then turned to crime. The criminal is then ...                See full summary »

5.name: Fire!
5.description: Firefighters ring for help, and here comes the ladder cart; they hitch a horse to it. A second horse-drawn truck joins the first, and they head down the street to a house fire. Inside a man...                See full summary »

6.name: Demolishing and Building Up the Star Theatre
6.description: Time-lapse photography is used to show the manual dismantling and demolition of New York's Star Theatre over a period of about 30 days.

7.name: Circular Panorama of Electric Tower
7.description: A most interesting picture at the Pan-American Exposition. The picture was taken from the north side of the Electric Tower. It presents the most perfect and diversified views of the ...                See full summary »

8.name: Execution of Czolgosz with Panorama of Auburn Prison
8.description: This early docudrama shows Auburn Prison and recreates the electrocution of Leon Czolgosz, the assassin of President McKinley of the United States. Some versions offer additional footage at...                See full summary »

10.name: What Happened on Twenty-third Street, New York City
10.description: A winner and sure to please. In front of one of the largest newspaper offices is a hot air shaft through which immense volumes of air are forced by a blower. Ladies in crossing this shaft ...                See full summary »

11.name: Scrooge; or Marley's Ghost
11.description: It's Christmas Eve. The miser Scrooge and his assistant Bob Cratchit finish their work in the office and go home. When Scrooge is going to open his front door, he sees the face of Marley's ...                See full summary »

12.name: Trapeze Disrobing Act
12.description: In this short silent film, we see Charmion an early vaudeville strongwomen, perform her famous Trapeze disrobing act. During the Victorian era, Charmion believed in promoting physical culture and dress reform for women.

13.name: Le diable géant ou Le miracle de la madonne
13.description: A magnificent Venetian oratory. On the left a large bay window through which may be seen the Grand Canal of the city of Venice. In the centre a colonnade and a hemicycle; to the right is a ...                See full summary »

14.name: The Haunted Curiosity Shop
14.description: An old proprietor is startled by the sudden appearance of a skull. Just as he draws back from the uncanny object, the doors of a mediaeval wardrobe fly back and a hand prods him with a ...                See full summary »

15.name: Dislocation mystérieuse
15.description: The funniest of all mystical pictures yet produced. Several body parts of a dancing clown float away from his body and come back again.

16.name: Stop Thief!
16.description: A hungry vagabond snatches a wrapped leg of lamb and jumps into a large wooden barrel to hide. Will he get away scot-free?

17.name: Great Waterfall of the Rhein at Schaffhausen, Switzerland
17.description: This picture is a perfect representation of the greatest waterfall in all Europe. A small row boat passes through the rapids approaching the falls. One large rock divides the river, and the...                See full summary »

18.name: The Trick Cyclist
18.description: Shows a tramp enter and try to ride a wheel, from which he makes some very ludicrous falls and gives up in despair, after which an artist enters and jumps rope on a wheel. A very laughable subject.

19.name: Pan-American Exposition by Night
19.description: A great feature of the Pan-American Exposition, as unanimously conceded by all visitors, was the electric illumination of the Exposition grounds at night. After a great deal of ...                See full summary »

20.name: Excelsior!
20.description: In this trickery extravaganza, Excelsior, the wizard of illusion, pulls out a handkerchief from his pocket, and after that, everything is possible in his rare and spectacular show.

21.name: Birth of the Pearl
21.description: In this picture there is a limited amount of action in the pose. As the curtains are drawn aside the shell appears shut. It gradually opens, disclosing the model curled up in a recumbent ...                See full summary »

22.name: Par le trou de la serrure
22.description: A hotel porter tries in his spare time to find out the secrets of the guests in looking through the keyholes of the different rooms. He must see very funny things, judging from his facial expressions.

23.name: Deaf Mute Recitation
23.description: A young girl reciting "The Star Spangled Banner" in sign language as taught at Gallaudet Institute.

24.name: Sham Battle at the Pan-American Exposition
24.description: On the closing day of the Pan-American Exposition, Saturday, November 2d, 1901, a sham battle took place at the Stadium on the Pan-American Exposition grounds, between the six tribes of ...                See full summary »

25.name: President McKinley's Speech at the Pan-American Exposition
25.description: In this picture we present a wonderful and life-like likeness of President McKinley. He first walks upon the platform, escorting Mrs. McKinley, whom he very reverently shows to a seat. The ...                See full summary »

26.name: Nain et géant
26.description: Georges Méliès plays the main character, as he splits into two versions of himself, and changes size.

27.name: Kansas Saloon Smashers
27.description: Reenactment of Carrie Nation's saloon smashing in Wichita.

28.name: Tally Ho!
28.description: A man dons a disguise to elope with the squire's daughter.

29.name: President McKinley Taking the Oath
29.description: Short film which documents William McKinley's presidential inauguration.

30.name: Le chapeau à surprises
30.description: The picture opens showing a gentleman in full evening dress costume. Removing his opera hat and cloak, he leaves the hat on the table and by a few passes causes it to assume immense ...                See full summary »

32.name: Duke of York at Montreal and Quebec

33.name: Catching an Early Train
33.description: Shows a suburbanite asleep in bed. He discovers he has overslept himself, and jumps out of bed. His shirt, trousers, shoes, collar, tie, coat, vest, hat, cane, cigar and satchel rise from ...                See full summary »

34.name: Chez la sorcière
34.description: A bachelor meets with a magician to conjure the perfect mate.

35.name: Another Job for the Undertaker
35.description: Shows a bedroom in a hotel. On the wall of the room is a conspicuous sign "Don't blow out the gas." A hayseed enters the room, accompanied by a bellboy. The boy deposits the Rube's bag and ...                See full summary »

36.name: Enfants annamites ramassant des sapèques devant la Pagode des Dames

37.name: Sampson-Schley Controversy
37.description: This subject is in three scenes, showing beautiful dissolving effects. Scene 3. The Man Behind that Teacup shows Admiral Sampson the centre of attraction of a group of old maids at an afternoon tea party.

39.name: President McKinley Inauguration
39.description: The first sequence (ca. 49 ft.), views of President William McKinley speaks to the crowd during his inauguration in Washington, DC. We see crowds on Pennsylvania Ave., NW, passing by the ...                See full summary »

40.name: La maison tranquille
40.description: This picture shows the ground floor and also the first floor front of a modern lodging house. In the lower room the landlord and his lady are having dinner, while above them four young men ...                See full summary »

41.name: Artistic Creation
41.description: Pierrot draws a lady in sections, and the parts come alive.

42.name: Local Scenes Landing of Sir M.M. Bhownuggree

43.name: The Countryman and the Cinematograph
43.description: A satire on the way that audiences unaccustomed to the cinema didn't know how to react to the moving images on a screen - in this film, an unsophisticated (and stereotypical) country yokel ...                See full summary »

44.name: Vue prise d'une baleinière en marche

45.name: A Phenomenal Contortionist
45.description: The scene opens in a beautiful garden scene. St. Elmo appears and proceeds to twist his anatomy into wonderful shapes. Several mysterious changes add great attraction to this subject.

46.name: L'omnibus des toqués blancs et noirs
46.description: Clowns ride in on a wagon drawn by a skeletal horse. The clowns proceed to transform from blackface performers to white costumed clowns, and back again, as they perform zany antics.

48.name: The Finish of Bridget McKeen
48.description: The cook has trouble lighting the stove, so she adds kerosene, with explosive results.

49.name: Fun in a Chinese Laundry
49.description: Sing Lee is busy with his ironing when Miss Mischief enters unobserved and tickles the Mongolian's neck with a duster, but upon being observed, runs from the place, the Chinaman falling in ...                See full summary »

50.name: President Roosevelt at the Canton Station
50.description: In this picture we show President Roosevelt and Cabinet standing at the station with bare heads, while the casket of President McKinley is being placed in the hearse. As the hearse leaves ...                See full summary »
